channel.title: Food glitch
channel.description: When i am pking in my server or fighting in general I can click on the very last food in my inventory fast and all the food is eaten. How do I make it to where the food has to be individually clicked on in each inven. slot to be eaten?

item.title: Food glitch
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Sorry, I forgot to mention one important thing.
You need to use the parameter to delete the item.
ChangedeleteItem(healing[4], GetItemSlot(healing[4]), 1);
to

deleteItem(healing[4], itemSlot, 1);

and your problem should be solved.

Read full topic

I hope I will start to understand it.

Before I just delve into moparscape programming. Should I make little programs so I will get down the basics?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 01, 2009, 10:14:15 pm[/size][hr]It is still eating away like crazy lol I will figure out how to fix it. I just need a tutorial on parameters probably.

item.title: Food glitch
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

public void healing(int itemSlot) {

That’s how you would use an integer as a parameter in the healing method.
Once you have made this change, the healing method must be called with a parameter.
So change every occurrence of healing() to healing(Slot).

Actually, find this if (healing[0] > 0) { healing(); }
and get rid of it. I don’t even know why that would be there.
The healing method should only be called once, in the checkItemForSkillUse3 method.

Read full topic

item.title: Food glitch
item.dc:creator: @dogzound5 dogzound5@gmail.com
item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

I just watched a 15 min tutorial on arrays. I am starting to get it but I am having a hard time applying it in client.java under the healing section. I see all the symbols but I dont get what it means because all the tutorials use a different method of using the ints and arrays.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 01, 2009, 10:00:33 pm[/size][hr]dont tell me the code but help me figure out the english translation of this.

[code]if (healTimer == 0 && healing[0] == 2) {
deleteItem(healing[4], GetItemSlot(healing[4]), 1);
int Heal = healing[1];
int HealDiff = (healing[2] - healing[1]);

        if (HealDiff > 0) {
            Heal += misc.random(HealDiff);
        }
        if (healing[3] != -1) {
            addItem(healing[3], 1);
        }
        NewHP = (playerLevel[playerHitpoints] + Heal);
        if (NewHP > getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerHitpoints])) {
            NewHP = getLevelForXP(playerXP[playerHitpoints]);
        }[/code]

so if the healtimer is 0 and you eat it deletes the food and selects the next slot to eat? Then it configures how much you are being healed and raises that from where your hp was?

Read full topic

item.title: Food glitch
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

An array is a container object that holds a fixed number of values of a single type.
You specify the type as you would any other variable. Ex: int[] arrayExample = new int[5];
The length of an array is established when the array is created.
The length of arrayExample would be the number between the square brackets, 5.
After creation, its length is fixed.
There are ways to increase the length of an array (you can use java.util.Arrays.copyOf()), but you shouldn't worry about that for now.
You've seen an example of arrays already, in the main method of the "Hello World!" application. This section discusses arrays in greater detail.
The "Hello World!" application uses an array as a parameter in the main method.

Read full topic

item.title: Food glitch
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

No, an array is an object that can hold multiple values of a single data type.

@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

dogzound5@gmail.com:

I read all of the tutorial links you gave me and then some. lol I am trying. It just gets soo hard. Ok, I am starting to understand the meanings of the whole healing sections but what does this part mean [3]?? there are different numbers in each one.

That’s an array. You can read about those here.

As wat72 said you’re not going to be able to have a good server if you don’t learn how to program, so read up.
When I was starting to learn how to program, I made my own little programs that made use of what I was learning about so I could get the hang of it and remember it.

item.title: Food glitch
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

It’s actually deleteItem(healing[4], GetItemSlot(healing[4]), 1);
in the healing() method. I know, it was a different method than I mentioned, but you have to follow the code to find out how everything is done.
You’ll need to modify your healing method to take the item slot as a parameter.

dogzound5@gmail.com:

lol. I already knew all these basics of class application etc…

You sure? You might want to read some of this:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/javaOO/classes.html
Unless I’m forgetting something, you should only have to read the classes/methods section.

Sorry, but I’m not just going to “spoon-feed” you code. I want to see you put some effort into it.
It’s the only way you’ll learn and become more independent.

Read full topic
